chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
P: code
Q: (nat * list X)%type
i: nat

Goal:
P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q

Premises:
in_code = fun (i : nat) P => code_start P <= i < code_end P : nat -> code -> Prop Arguments in_code _%nat_scope _ /
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
subcode_start_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
in_out_code : forall (i : nat) P, in_code i P -> out_code i P -> False
subcode_trans : forall P (Q R : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> Q <sc R -> P <sc R
subcode_length : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> code_start Q <= code_start P /\ code_end P <= code_end Q
subcode_length_le : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> fst Q <= fst P /\ fst P + length (snd P) <= fst Q + length (snd Q)
subcode_length' : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> length (snd P) <= length (snd Q)
ZifyClasses.rew_iff : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> P -> Q
subcode = fun P (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : code -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode _ _ /
out_code = fun (i : nat) P => i < code_start P \/ code_end P <= i : nat -> code -> Prop Arguments out_code _%nat_scope _ /
subcode_cons_inj : forall (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) P, (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
subcode_refl : forall P, P <sc P
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
well_founded_induction : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Set, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
in_out_code_dec : forall (i : nat) P, {in_code i P} + {out_code i P}
code_start = fun P => fst P : code -> nat Arguments code_start _ /
code_end = fun P => fst P + length (snd P) : code -> nat Arguments code_end _ /
interval_dec : forall a b i : nat, {a <= i < b} + {i < a \/ b <= i}
code = (nat * list X)%type : Type
code_length = fun P => length (snd P) : code -> nat Arguments code_length _ /
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } Arguments QArith_base.Qmake _%Z_scope _%positive_scope
QArith_base.to_decimal = fun q : QArith_base.Q => let choose_exponent := fun (i : Decimal.int) (ne : nat) => let i0 := match i with | Decimal.Pos i0 | Decimal.Neg i0 => i0 end in let li := Decimal.nb_digits i0 in let le := Decimal.nb_digits (Nat.to_uint ne) in li + le <? ne in let decimal_exponent := fun (i : Decimal.int) (ne : nat) => let e := BinInt.Z.to_int (BinInt.Z.opp (BinInt.Z.of_nat ne)) in Decimal.DecimalExp i Decimal.Nil e in let decimal_dot := fun (i : Decimal.int) (ne : nat) => let ai := match i with | Decimal.Pos i0 | Decimal.Neg i0 => i0 end in let ni := Decimal.nb_digits ai in if ne <? ni then let i0 := Decimal.del_tail_int ne i in let f := Decimal.del_head (ni - ne) ai in Decimal.Decimal i0 f else let z := match i with | Decimal.Pos _...
Tauto.xror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * list Annot
Tauto.ror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * list Annot
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)

```coq
intros Hsc Hi.
apply ZifyClasses.rew_iff with (P := in_code i P) (Q := in_code i Q).
- apply in_out_code_dec.
- intros HiP.
  apply subcode_start_in_code with (P := P) (Q := Q); trivial.
Qed.```
